title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Kevin Durant scored 26 points as the Houston Rockets defeated the Boston Celtics 128-101, ending Boston's three-game win streak.
Boston faced exhaustion playing their third game in four days, impacting their performance against the Rockets and resulting in a substantial loss.
Baylor Scheierman led the Celtics with 17 points, but the team struggled overall, highlighted by a significant 35-7 free-throw disparity.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevated running back D'Ernest Johnson from the practice squad for Sunday's game against the Atlanta Falcons.
Johnson, a seven-year NFL veteran, joins TreVeyon Henderson and Terrell Jennings in the Patriots' backfield.
With Rhamondre Stevenson injured, Johnson could play a role on offense and special teams, including kick returns.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov have formed a successful defensive pair, improving the Bruins' defense after a weak start.
The Bruins' defense, led by McAvoy and Zadorov, allowed only one 5-on-5 goal in 73:24 ice time this season.
Hampus Lindholm's return and Jonathan Aspirot's steady play have further bolstered Boston's defense, now more cohesive and effective.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed one goal in the Bruins' 2-1 win over the Carolina Hurricanes on Saturday.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm rotated goalies, giving Joonas Korpisalo back-to-back starts after Swayman's rough game against Ottawa.
Swayman holds a better save percentage (.896) and goals saved above expected (2.0) compared to Korpisalo.

title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Red Sox face the offseason with potential luxury tax concerns, having $218.92 million committed in salaries for 2026.
Key players like Alex Bregman and Trevor Story may opt out, affecting the Red Sox's infield plans and free agent acquisitions.
Possible trade targets for the Red Sox include pitchers like Joe Ryan and Freddy Peralta, addressing their pitching needs.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty will call his third Patriots game of the regular season as part of CBS's broadcast crew.
The Patriots, led by quarterback Drake Maye, have a 6-2 record, exceeding preseason expectations.
McCourty, former Patriots defensive back, is surprised by the team's rapid improvement under coach Mike Vrabel.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are reportedly interested in acquiring Miami Dolphins edge rusher Jaelan Phillips before the trade deadline.
Dolphins are seeking at least a third-round pick for Phillips, who is excelling in pressures and pass-rush win rate.
Phillips has been productive despite the Dolphins' struggles, logging three sacks and 32 pressures this season.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei was scratched for the third consecutive Boston Bruins game against the Hurricanes.
Coach Marco Sturm suggests Lohrei should be 'pissed' at being sidelined, emphasizing it as a learning period.
Lohrei's defensive pairing with Charlie McAvoy was outscored 10-7, leading to changes with Hampus Lindholm and Nikita Zadorov.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Bijan Robinson leads the NFL in scrimmage yards per game with 137.4, posing a significant dual-threat challenge for the Patriots.
Falcons quarterback Michael Penix has struggled outdoors, losing all three starts and completing 53.1% of passes with a 65.5 rating.
The Falcons' defense ranks second in yards allowed per game, with strong performances in their secondary led by cornerback A.J. Terrell.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts hit a crucial two-run single for the Dodgers in Game 6, giving them a 3-0 lead.
Kiké Hernandez made a pivotal defensive play, throwing out a runner to secure the Dodgers' 3-1 victory.
The Dodgers' win over the Blue Jays forces a Game 7 in the World Series, helped by former Red Sox players.
